org.netbeans.spi.wizard
Interface Wizard

public interface Wizard

Note:It is quite rare to need to directly implement this interface. If you want to create a Wizard with a fixed set of steps, implement WizardPanelProvider and call createWizard on it.

If you have a wizard that has choice-points, where depending on what the user chooses on one pane, the subsequent number or set of panes will change, implement WizardBranchController to supply different sub-wizards depending on the user's choices, and call createWizard to get the result. WizardBranchController will let you provide a choice of WizardPanelProviders depending on what the user enters. For most cases no more is needed.

To display any Wizard to the user, call WizardDisplayer.show (someWizard)

The one case in which it may be necessary to implement this interface directly is if you have a Wizard that for some reason needs to disable the Prev button (this is not a good idea from a usability standpoint). For all other cases, consider using one of WizardPanelProvider or WizardBranchController - they are much simpler to work with.

This class is the Wizard interface - a Wizard is a series of one or more steps represented by panels in the user interface. Each step is identified by a String ID. For each ID, the navigatedTo() method supplies a component to be displayed to the user.

Each panel may add settings to a Map, which is passed to navigatedTo(). At the conclusion of a Wizard (if/when the user presses the Finish button), the method finish (Map settings) is invoked, and the Wizard may instantiate whatever it needs to and return that. It is up to the caller to do something with the return value.

Wizards should never make any changes to their environment except in the finish() method - until that is called, they should simply collect information.

The IDs of steps of the wizard should be returned by the method getAllIDs(). If a Wizard contains branching, such that all of the steps cannot be determined, it should return an array of Strings terminated with the special ID UNDETERMINED_STEP; as the set of following steps becomes known, it should fire stepsChange() to any registered WizardListeners.

Author:
Tim Boudreau
See Also:
WizardPanelProvider, WizardBranchController, WizardDisplayer

Field Detail

UNDETERMINED_STEP

public static final java.lang.String UNDETERMINED_STEP
Special panel ID key indicating a branch point in the wizard, after which the next step(s) are unknown.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

navigatingTo

public javax.swing.JComponent navigatingTo(java.lang.String id,
                                           java.util.Map settings)
Set which step of the wizard is currently being displayed and get the component for that step. The ID passed becomes the currently active step of the wizard as of this call; if the user has already been to this step, entered some settings and then pressed the Back button, then pressed Next again, the settings map may already contain settings for this step. If this method is called as a result of the user pressing the Back button, the settings map will not contain any settings added by the next panel, only settings from panels that precede this one.

The identity of the settings map is guaranteed to be the same for all calls to this method for one wizard.

Implementations are expected to return the same component if navigatingTo() is called repeatedly with the same ID.

Note: If a later panel removes or changes a value entered in an earlier step, that change is permanent. Each step should provide its own keys and values, not modify those from other steps.

Parameters:
id - The ID of the to-be-current panel
settings - map user-entered settings should be put in
Returns:
a component that should be displayed in the wizard

getNextStep

public java.lang.String getNextStep()
Get the String ID of the next panel. If the Next button should be disabled, return null.

Returns:
The unique ID of the step that follows the one currently presented in the UI, as determined by the last call to navigateTo

getPreviousStep

public java.lang.String getPreviousStep()
Get the String ID of the previous panel. If the Prev button should be disabled, return null.

Returns:
the String ID of the step that precedes the one currently presented in this Wizards UI, or null if it is either the first step or the preceding step is unknown, as determined by the last call to navigateTo

canFinish

public boolean canFinish()
Return true if the Finish button should be enabled.

Returns:
if the finish button should be enabled

getProblem

public java.lang.String getProblem()
Get a human readable description of the reason the Next/Finish button is not enabled (i.e. "#\foo is not a legal filename").

Returns:
A localized string that describes why the Next/Finish button is not enabled, or null if one or the other or both should be enabled

getAllSteps

public java.lang.String[] getAllSteps()
Get String IDs for all the steps in the wizard (regardless of whether Finish/Next can be enabled or not). If there is a branch point in the wizard and it cannot be determined what step will be next beyond some point, make the final entry in the returned array the constant UNDETERMINED_STEP, and fire stepsChange() to any listeners once the later steps become known.

The return value of this method must be an array of Strings at least one String in length; if length == 1, that String may not be UNDETERMINED_STEP; UNDETERMINED_STEP may only be the final ID, and only if there is more than one step.

Returns:
An array of strings that constitute unique IDs of each step in the wizard. The returned array may not contain duplicate entries.

getStepDescription

public java.lang.String getStepDescription(java.lang.String id)
Get a human-readable description for a given panel, as identified by the passed ID.

addWizardListener

public void addWizardListener(Wizard.WizardListener listener)
Add a listener for changes in the count or order of steps in this wizard and for changes in Next/Previous/Finish button enablement.

Parameters:
listener - A listener to add

removeWizardListener

public void removeWizardListener(Wizard.WizardListener listener)
Remove a listener for changes in the count or order of steps in this wizard and for changes in Next/Previous/Finish button enablement.

Parameters:
listener - A listener to remove

finish

public java.lang.Object finish(java.util.Map settings)
                        throws WizardException
Finish the wizard, (optionally) instantiating some Object and returning it. For cases where the map may contain settings too expensive to validate on the fly, this method may throw a WizardException with a localized message indicating the problem; that exception can indicate a step in the wizard to return to to allow the user to correct the information.

No methods on a Wizard instance should be called after that Wizard's finish() method has been called - the results are undefined.

Parameters:
settings - A map containing all of the settings the user has entered as they traversed this wizard - presumably enough to do whatever this method needs to do (if not, that's a bug in the implementation of Wizard).
Throws:
WizardException

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
Get the title of the wizard.

Returns:
A human-readable, localized title that should be displayed in any dialog showing this wizard

isBusy

public boolean isBusy()
Determine if all navigation buttons should be disabled - if the wizard is currently doing some kind of progress/background processing task that cannot be interrupted.
